entry.title: Exploring CDS based Analytical Models with the Relation Explorer - analytical view/perspective
entry.content:
Relation explorer analytical view / analytical perspective makes it easy to get an overview of the analytical model with very less clicks. No need to open all the views to understands details.

We start small , looking to a branch of a star schema , dimension Connection ( /DMO/ANA_I_Connection ) which is part of the flight data model.  After calling the relation explorer we see the Relation Explorer Tab in the below section of the screenshot.

Relation Explorer tab shows:

  • in the left pane the associations from the dimension to other CDS views over all levels are visualizes . It starts fully expanded!
    next to the CDS view name we see the view type. E.g. /DMO/ANA_I_CARRIER is of type [Dimension]
  • in the right pane one can see all the elements of current view. As /DMO/ANA_I_Connection is selected all elements of this dimension are displayed.
    • One can select (single click) any other view e.g. /DMO/ANA_I_CARRIER and the right pane get updated with the elements of that view.
    • double clicking the view will directly open the view 
  • the right pane displays all elements grouped by roles.
    • In this example we have 2 keys and e.g. expanding AirlineID show label and additional details about association and InfoObject. In case of compounded parent we would have seen the Parent element.
    • double clicking AirlineID highlight the element in the source ( see line 21 )
    • [Text] gives a hint that AirlineID has text, this is missing for ConnetionID -> no Text supported
    • Attributes list all dimension attributes. Last one, DistanceUnit is a Unit element.
    • the Unit group show all unit related elements.
    • other group are shown if relevant.

One can also start the analytical Relation Explorer based on query or cube view.
In both cases the cube view is opened and visualizes the cube with all associations .

We change focus and look to the example of a query - starting relation explorer shows the cube definition including dimension Connection from above.

with one view

  • in the left pane we get all associations visualizes. View names are shown with the view types
  • in the right pane we can see all 13 dimensions of the cube and get if dimension support Text, have Attributes or Hierarchies
    • from 1st screenshot we already know that Text, Attributes and Hierarchies are available for AirlineID
    • expanding ConnectionID show that it is compounded to AirlineID
  • we see all 5 measures with additional details like aggregation method and unit
  • with " Units (2) " we see the unit related dimensions. This section only list those dimension that are unit relevant.  Expanding the dimension like CurrencyCode lists all related measures. 
    ( Both dimension are also listed in dimension section. )
  • for time based dimension one can directly understand the base dimension and wherefrom it is derived without looking into the source ( see below snippet with FiscalYearMonth )

 

How to start the Relation Explorer

call relation explorer to see the view

right click somewhere in the CDS view 

( in case of CDS view type cube, dimension or query the analytical view is the default view )

  • If the view is not shown, choose Configure Context and activate it.
  • one can switch any time to different perspective / context if needed

 

 

 

Release Info:  analytical view / analytical perspective started with

  • BW/4HANA 2023 FP 04 
  • S/4HANA Public Cloud and Privat Cloud OP2023

entry.title: Crystal Reports Designer 2020 Showing Ruler in cm Page Setup in Inches
entry.content:
I've spent over an hour with both Copilot and Gemini AI and all state the same thing.  My Regional Format is set to United States.  My "Windows Display Language" is set to Canada.  Under control panel, Region, the format shows United States, Additional Settings shows Measurement System to to "U.S.".  

If I open ANY other application, the rulers are all imperial, which I want, since it's ingrained that a page is 8.5 inches.  

Why is Crystal confused as to what the measurements should be?  If the File > Page Setup shows "Inches" then should the ruler not match?  My windows display needs to be Canada and there are no other places to set measurement so Crystal is the issue.

entry.title: Re: Dive into the future of SAP Universal ID and understand the changes underway
entry.content:
Hello @bharatbajaj,

Please try the following steps to unlink the unnecessary identities:

  1. Under Identities tab, select the P-user which you would like to unlink from the UID account
  2. Click the three dots button in the top right window and then choose "Unlink Identity"
  3. Confirm the pop-up and the P-user should be unlinked.

entry.title: Re: Message and Header exchange from Child to Parent flows
entry.content:
Hi Aananda,

Sorry for the delay in response.

Thanks for the details. Now I understand that you are only experiencing this issue when the child flow fails. This is the intended behavior as the child process couldn't complete. Hence, details were not persisted. If you would like to propagate header as well as payload(custom exception) from exception subprocess to main iFlow, you need to replace Error end in exception subprocess to Message end.

The drawback of this approach would be that child iFlow would appear as Completed in message monitoring.

Thanks!

Kind regards,

Shweta

entry.title: Re: Enhancements to SAP Community - September 2025
entry.content:
That’s a very clear and well-thought-out update, and from a technical and community management perspective, it makes a lot of sense. Excessive tagging is often treated as a quick visibility hack, but it comes with several downsides:

  1. Search & Indexing Efficiency – Fewer, more precise tags reduce noise in the internal search engine. When each piece of content has dozens of tags, search relevance drops and indexing systems struggle to rank results properly.

  2. Notification Overload – The limit on SAP Managed Tags, user tags, and labels helps avoid unnecessary notifications for irrelevant content. Technically, this reduces background load on subscription/notification services as well, since fewer tags mean fewer triggered alerts.

  3. Content Discoverability – Over-tagging dilutes context. By enforcing a maximum, the system ensures that metadata is more meaningful. This improves navigation for end users and enhances the performance of recommendation algorithms that rely on tags and labels.

  4. System Integrity & Consistency – From a backend standpoint, restricting tags prevents database bloat. Unlimited or excessive tagging often leads to redundant, duplicate, or misspelled entries, which makes it harder to maintain a clean taxonomy.

  5. Future-Proofing – With SAP Managed Tags tied to an official taxonomy, limiting the total encourages contributors to align content with strategic categories. This not only improves discoverability today but also ensures cleaner migration and scaling in future platform updates.

In short, this change isn’t just about reducing clutter — it’s a structural adjustment that balances user experience, backend efficiency, and long-term taxonomy health. Members who apply tags thoughtfully will see higher engagement because their content will surface to the right audience instead of being buried in irrelevant feeds.

Would you like me to also draft a best practices checklist for contributors (like “choose 1–3 SAP tags, avoid duplicates, use descriptive labels”) that you could share with your team/community for smoother adoption of this new tagging policy?

Thank you providing such insights through this forum https://community.sap.com/t5/what-s-new /buy to let enhancements-to-sap-community-september-2025/ba-p/14231974

Building on that, this policy also encourages contributors to think critically about the true focus of their content instead of relying on tag spamming for visibility. It fosters a more disciplined publishing culture where precision is valued over volume. Over time, this will strengthen the quality of metadata across the platform, making both search and filtering more accurate. Ultimately, the change benefits not only the platform’s technical performance but also the community’s overall trust and satisfaction.

entry.title: Re: Hyperlinks removed following upgrade to SP5 P100
entry.content:
There was a bug affecting hyperlinks and authorized URLs that use the asterisk (*) character.
This issue has been resolved in the latest patch for BI 4.3 SP04, SP05, and the 2025 release.
BI 4.3 SP05 – Patch 200 has been officially released today

3649840 - 'Read content as' Hyperlink option for cell does not work in Web Intelligence report when using * as Authorized URL

entry.title: Re: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Error during the Migration of...
entry.content:
Hello @LukasKuhn 

Thank you for your follow-up and for sharing the screenshot that clarifies it.

The notes displayed in Manage Business Partner (F3163) → Basic Data are Business Partner texts, specifically text objects like BUT000. That is why Text ID 0002 Accounting note functions correctly when added manually there. SAP Support Portal-3326351 - Error "Text Object BUT000 Does not Exist" occurs in Fiori App Manage Business Partner Master Data

KNA1 is the general Customer text object; posting to KNA1 wouldn’t appear in BP Basic Data

If you need further support, do let me know

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: New Developer Forums!
entry.content:
Thank you Thank you Thank you for making not only an explicit integration forum but also not limiting it to SAP Integration Suite as I literally live in the integration space.  Also thank you for building what looks to be some great forums that are well thought out and were desperately needed.  I give whomever came up with all of this at least a 9.5 out of 10 for well thought out forums that make sense and will make it far easier to find answers.

I do agree with @anantkamal that existing forum posts in forums that aren't part of this new grouping need to be gone through and things moved to the new forums.  Yes it will be a pain, but it will be worth it.  SAP has done a lot of great work with SCN, especially with adding moderators and giving them power to delete posts from years ago in the wild wolly SDN days that were nothing more than posts to get points to go to Tech-Ed for free - I'm glad those days are over because  trying to read groups with those things in them was exhausting and made it virtually impossible to follow most groups.  I get that there are some FAQ questions but if I see another post on what is the transaction to view a sales order I will scream.

I go back to when I first started with SAP 20 years ago when we purchase it and in those days it was SDN and what SCN has become is fantastic and much improved.

entry.title: About CDP Monitoring tool
entry.content:
1. Action from the custom connector is not fetching activity data when we run from the playground
2. We found that successful actions logs are not showing detailed activation payload.



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: About CDP Monitoring tool
entry.content:
a) Action from the custom connector is not fetching activity data when we run from the playground

This is correct. As per documentation Actions playground the activity is not included in records from playground.


b) We found that successful actions logs are not showing detailed activation payload. - If this note is related to CDP Monitoring tool, please review documentation Monitoring dashboard

Specifically, for Activation monitoring dashboard there is action message details page where customers can get a detailed overview of an error or discarded message and its occurrences.

After selecting an error or discarded message from the Action Failures, Discarded, Attempted Retries message table, or the Logs table, a screen opens providing a detailed overview of the latest occurrences of the selected message.

This is current functionality of the tool that it shows additional logs only for error responses.

Our suggestion is to review and implement one of log providers and send data to provider via Log connector. Documentation: Log connector

entry.title: Re: Understanding ABAP Pipeline Engine used for Data Integration in Datasphere
entry.content:
/1DH/CDC_RLFW_SWITCH_RUNNING is likely used by the CDC engine in SAP to control or signal that the replication flow (RLFW) is in a “switch-over” or “resuming” state, probably after downtime.

Look for jobs named /1DH/CDC_RLFW_SWITCH_RUNNING in transaction SM37 (perhaps filtered by day or system restarts).

If found, look at the job steps, start times, and outcomes.

Regards.

David

entry.title: Re: The description of the cost center are not displayed.
entry.content:
Hello @suyoung_choi3 

That is correct; the Custom Cost Center Hierarchies  Manage Global Hierarchies, F2918 support Valid From/To, allowing you to time-slice them. The default standard hierarchy “1” does not have a configurable validity period; only the cost center assignments within it can be modified.

Does it answer your question?

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP MDG: Validation - Notes Mandatory
entry.content:
Hi SCN Folks, 

Hope you guys are doing great 🙂

Note 01: This blog does not include execution screenshots.
Note 02: The entire code was developed and validated in the SANDBOX system, with results meeting expectations.

This post outlines a custom development approach in SAP Master Data Governance (MDG) to enforce mandatory entry of Notes during master data processes. The validation logic is implemented using the enhancement framework via:
BADI:USMD_RULE_SERVICE, specifically through the method CHECK_ENTITY.

This ensures that users provide the required notes, thereby improving data completeness, auditability, and compliance during master data creation and change activities.

Code:

DATA:
  lv_cr_number TYPE usmd_crequest,
  lv_crtype    TYPE usmd_crequest_type,
  lv_process   TYPE usmd_process.

DATA(lo_context) = cl_usmd_app_context=>get_context( ).

IF lo_context IS BOUND.
  CALL METHOD lo_context->get_attributes
    IMPORTING
      ev_crequest_id   = lv_cr_number
      ev_crequest_type = lv_crtype
      ev_process       = lv_process.
ENDIF.

IF lv_crtype EQ 'ZSUCRTYPE'.
  DATA(lv_s_notes) = cl_usmd_conv_som_gov_api=>get_instance( )->get_notes( ).
       IF lv_s_notes IS INITIAL.
          APPEND cl_usmd_message=>convert_text2_message(
          EXPORTING
          iv_message_text = 'Please Maintain Notes, It's Mandatory !!!'.
          iv_message_type = 'E' ) to et_message.
       ENDIF.
ENDIF.

 

SAP S/4HANA SAP Master Data Governance ABAP Development 

Thank You, 
Sandeep Suggu.
SAP Community Profile | SAP Profile | LinkedIn

entry.title: 🟡 Fun for Week 2: Petoberfest 🐱🐶🐵🐷🐻🐸🐔🐴🦬🦎🐠🦜🐧🐌🐛
entry.content:
Welcome to Petoberfest, a traditional of Devtoberfest when you get a chance to show off your beloved pet hamster, cat, iguana, dog or whatever your pet is.

  • 👉Post a picture of your pet.
  • 👉Do not have a living, breathing pet? Upload a picture of your favorite neighbor's pet, or your favorite stuffed animal, or your favorite zoo animal, or any animal that tickles your fancy. Just participate!
  • 👉You can also upload a picture of you participating in any animal welfare activity (more on World Animal Day, below).

Here's my dog, Pepper, begging for food and enjoying a day at the beach.

   

It wouldn't be anything without AI

And just to make it a little bit more interesting, upload a picture of your pet, then use the picture with any generative AI tool to create your pet doing something fun: like ....

  • Doing your SAP programming work
  • Flying to save the day
  • Sipping a pina colada on the beach
  • ... or whatever you think of.

Be creative, in what your pet is doing, as well as the style of the image.

Here's Pepper expressing her love for SAP Build and helping me create my Devtoberfest Cryptic Crossword (she really does help me).

But I'm sure you can be much more creative.

World Animal Day

Petoberfest coincides with World Animal Day (Oct. 4), which "exists to raise the status of animals and improve welfare standards around the globe". 

According to the World Animal Day group in Cheltenham, Gloucestershire::

It’s a day for all animal lovers near and far.  Through organised events, big and small,  we raise awareness of how animals are treated globally. We rally together organisations, children’s groups, schools, clubs, companies, communities and individuals to show we care deeply about animals.

One way you can show you care about animals is to post a picture of your pet, or a picture of any activity you participate in to help the welfare of animals.

Point, Points, Points

Everyone who posts images of their pets will receive 1000 points toward the Devtoberfest grand prize.

So post today, and comment and like the other community members' posts.

entry.title: Top Reasons to Modernize with SAP HANA Cloud – Blog #5 in the Series
entry.content:
This is the final chapter in this blog series on the benefits of migrating to SAP HANA Cloud. In each blog, I’ve described key features that offer significant benefits for your organization and can help you build your business case for SAP HANA Cloud.

Although it can be difficult calculating the business value of migrating your database to the cloud, the expertise of independent organizations can be helpful. A recent IDC study[1]  used a specialized business value methodology to assess the benefits of SAP HANA Cloud delivered to participating organizations. IDC concluded that the benefits were worth an annual average of US$13.7 million per organization and that the database enabled a 35% three-year reduction in total cost of ownership.

If you don’t have time to read this report, I encourage you to complete your own organization assessment using our free tool. In less than five minutes, you’ll receive useful insights that can help you decide your next steps.

 

Let’s consider two more features of SAP HANA Cloud that can help you realize significant business value: comprehensive security and a complete application development ecosystem.

Comprehensive security

Protecting your data and helping ensure compliance are top concerns for every organization. As business operations and workforces become more distributed, the need to provide secure data access from anywhere in the world intensifies.

SAP HANA Cloud offers robust security features that cover critical data protection areas, including authentication, authorization, user management, data masking, anonymization, and encryption. Because these features are built into the database, you have little or no need for third-party security tools. These capabilities also reduce the administrative effort needed to protect data.

Support for multiple security certifications and standards, such as ISO (International Organization for Standardization) and SOC (Standard Occupational Classification), helps ensure regulatory compliance. Configurable audit policies streamline compliance activities while helping protect your business and your customers. Automated updates to libraries and applications also boost security.

These features help make it faster and simpler to meet your security goals. According to the IDC report, the security teams of organizations that deployed SAP HANA Cloud increased efficiency by 19%. This benefit translates into an average annual business value of $183,016 per organization.

One study participant from the agriculture industry cited the database security standards and policies of SAP HANA Cloud, considering it an extra protective layer to reinforce security. “If we had an on-premises database, we’d lack this added protection,” said the interviewee. “The entire platform has policies that prevent mistakes. For instance, SAP now requires updates to libraries and applications for security reasons. These requirements from SAP keep us updated and secure.”

Another participant from the healthcare industry viewed the advanced protection as a financial advantage. “SAP HANA Cloud is a much more secure system that makes data more accessible and applications perform faster,” he said. “This has helped us meet our customers’ needs much better and has improved our revenue by about five percent.”

A complete application development ecosystem

Time and resources are tight for your development teams. Demand from business users has never been higher, new use cases are emerging, and the need for different developer skill sets seems to continually grow.

SAP HANA Cloud can help address these challenges with an integrated development ecosystem based on SAP Build solutions. SAP Build offers a comprehensive group of tools that support the full spectrum of no-code/low-code, pro-code, and generative AI development approaches. With SAP Build and SAP HANA Cloud, you can support developers at any skill level with the right tools.

Developers can build intelligent applications that use generative AI and harness their expertise and data. Applications built on SAP HANA Cloud can use intelligent algorithms to process large volumes of data and provide actionable recommendations. SAP HANA Cloud also includes machine learning libraries that help developers build sophisticated analytics applications that augment user expertise. By incorporating AI-driven insights, these applications help you anticipate future trends and predict behaviors, make business decisions faster, and improve business performance.

The IDC report found that these application development capabilities deliver quantifiable business value. IDC estimates that development team productivity spiked by 30% in the surveyed organizations, creating staff time savings of $361,519 per organization.  

SAP HANA Cloud features, such as information libraries, combined with faster performance and easier integrations, helped developers build more complex applications such as those using machine learning and AI. Overall, participants developed or deployed 154% more features and applications annually than they could without SAP HANA Cloud.

One study participant explained the impact of this value on the development team. “SAP HANA Cloud provides developers with more seamless integrations, and it is easy to use,” the interviewee explained. “They spend less time writing code because they can reuse code and use the libraries.”

 

Explore additional SAP HANA Cloud resources

As we’ve seen in this , the advanced features of SAP HANA Cloud offer significant value for organizations like yours. To help you make your business case for SAP HANA Cloud, check out the following resources:

  • What’s the potential value of SAP HANA Cloud for your organization? Complete a short assessment. 
  • Learn more about SAP HANA Cloud.
  • Discover how moving to SAP HANA Cloud helps you create a foundation for modernization.
  • Explore this guide on building a compelling business case to move your database to the cloud.

 

[1] “The Business Value of SAP HANA Cloud,” IDC, sponsored by SAP, April 2025.

entry.title: Re: Is DRC worth to learn
entry.content:
Hi @Mers 
Thanks @iprieto for sharing your insight and also the link.
Here are some additonal learning material: 

  •  Introducing SAP Document and Reporting Compliance
    After completing this lesson, you will be able to:
    • Explain the end-to-end process flow and SAP Document and Reporting Compliance from end user perspective
    • Distinguish the different deployment options for SAP Document and Reporting Compliance
    • Describe the high level architecture of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
    • Outline what a compliance task is, and which ones are supported by SAP Document and Reporting Compliance
  • SAP Document and Reporting Compliance - Statutory Reporting leanring jounrey and leanr to master the skills needed to implement and customize features of SAP S/4HANA for advanced compliance reporting (Valid for SAP S/4HANA OP, SAP S/4HANA Cloud (public), private and extended editions)
  • Please access in our SAP Discovery Center  the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, electronic document error handling  page to get easy-to-understand explanations for electronic document errors with Joule.
  • Please access in our SAP Help  Center the  SAP Document and Reporting Compliance page  to learn more 

Kind regards
Margit

entry.title: Re: SAP S4 Finance
entry.content:
Hi @manichemi1 ,

StepActionTransaction / AppDetails / Notes
1Check user tolerance groupSU01Select user → Company Code Data → Tolerance Group assigned to user.
2Maintain tolerance amounts for company codeOBA3 (G/L Tolerance Groups) or OBAR / F110 (Payment Tolerances)Select the tolerance group → enter maximum debit/credit differences or over/underpayment amounts → Save.
3Re-run posting/paymentTransaction where error occurredAfter maintaining tolerances, posting/payment should process successfully.

Summary:-
- Tolerance groups are user + company code specific.
- Amounts can be absolute or percentage.
- Ensure the correct user and company code are configured.

entry.title: Re: How to identify in debugging that document posted is...
entry.content: I checked the field I_RBKPV-INV_TRAN, but it appears to be blank for both credit memos and invoices. However, I noticed that the field I_RBKPV-XRECH contains the value 'X' for invoices and is blank for credit memos. Additionally, there are two other fields: I_RBKPV-XRECHL and I_RBKPV-XRECHR, where I observed the value 'S' for invoices and 'H' for credit memos. Can these fields be considered reliable indicators to distinguish between invoices and credit memos?

entry.title: Re: Service organization missing some plants
entry.content:
Only due to below three reasons, you will have that issue

  1. You have not assigned a company code to the purchasing organization.
  2. You have not maintained a standard purchasing organization or sales organization relationship for the plant.
  3. You have not assigned the sales area to the plant.

If you are sure, all the above are done and still you face the issue, then, I feel, you need to take the help of ABAP, set a break point in the program and see what is the root cause

entry.title: Re: Revenue posting for Usage based billing
entry.content:
Below would be the Diagnostic Checklist

Confirm the billing element in the customer project is correctly configured for usage-based billing. Ensure the contract type (e.g., P007) is mapped to the correct revenue recognition key in SSCUI 103631.

Check the service material used in the usage-based billing document and is it correctly linked to the Service Product Type Mapping (SPTM)? Is the material extended to the relevant org units in Development?

Validate that the revenue recognition key is assigned to the billing element and is active in Development. Compare this setup with Starter system to spot discrepancies.

Even for usage-based billing, cost rates must be maintained in Manage Cost Rates – Professional Services. Missing or zero cost rates can block revenue postings.

Check if Event-Based Revenue Recognition is enabled for the relevant service documents and project types. Use SSCUI 103631 and 104045 to verify derivation logic and account determination.

After running EBRR jobs, use Display Journal Entries and Revenue Recognition (Event-Based) – Line Items to check. Are there any failed postings? Are entries skipped due to missing configuration?

entry.title: How to withdraw the approval request of a sales order without charge
entry.content:
Dear,

We would like to request guidance on how to withdraw approval for a Sales Order Without Charge.

Thank you for your support.
Best regards.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to withdraw the approval request of a sales order...
entry.content:
Hello,

There are two possibilities for withdrawing an approval request for a sales order of type CBFD - Sales Order Without Charge:

  • Using the app Manage Sales Orders Without Charge - Version 2 (ID: F2305A): the button for withdrawing the approval request can be seen on the top-right corner.
  • Using the app Display Sales Documents (VA03): it's possible to withdraw the approval request via menu > edit > additional functions > withdraw approval request.

For other types of documents, the app Display Sales Documents functions on the same way, and the manage version 2 app for the document type can also be used, for example:

  • Sales Order > Manage Sales Orders - version 2
  • Credit Memo Request > Manage Credit Memo Requests - version 2

Kind regards.

entry.title: Re: SAP MDG: Validation - Notes Mandatory
entry.content:
Several syntax errors: convert_text2_message doesn't exist but convert_text2message exists, the quote should be doubled for "it's", the dot after !!! should be removed, like this:

      APPEND cl_usmd_message=>convert_text2message(
          iv_message_text = 'Please Maintain Notes, It''s Mandatory !!!'
          iv_message_type = 'E' ) TO et_message.

entry.title: Accessibility by Design: A User-Centered Update to the Accessibility Design Tools
entry.content:
(co-authored by Irla Rebelo Bocianoski, Nina Krauss, and Stefan Schnabel)

Every great product starts with a great plan. Think of a design as the blueprint for a digital experience. At its best, this blueprint ensures accessibility isn't an afterthought but is built in from the start. The most successful blueprints are rich with detail, showing not just how something should look but also how it should work. A design provides a set of cues for people navigating by touch, voice, keyboard, or screen reader. For an inclusive experience, we need to design with the awareness that people may depend on alternative ways to operate and perceive it—because someone does.

That's why SAP's Accessibility Design Tools were created: to provide the essential annotations to turn an inclusive plan into a detailed accessibility blueprint. For two years, they've helped teams embed accessibility considerations in the design phase and intentionally design accessible experiences. Today, we're excited to announce the second edition of the Accessibility Design Tools, with a greater emphasis on who we are designing and developing for: The User.

Promotional cover for SAP’s “Accessibility Design Tools, Second Edition.” Features the SAP logo and a white accessibility icon on a blue graphic with abstract user interface elements.

 An accessibility blueprint people can depend on

Over the past two years, as teams across SAP and the Figma community adopted the Accessibility Design Tools, we listened and learned alongside them. We saw what worked, what sparked new ideas, and where we could make creating accessible and inclusive experiences even more intuitive. This feedback led us to examine our tools from the perspectives of designers, the product team, and most importantly, the end user. This led us to a central guiding question:

How can our tools best help teams create an accessibility blueprint that truly serves the people who depend on it?

The answer to this guiding question is at the heart of the Accessibility Design Tools Handbook - Second Edition. We reframed our tools to be organized not by technical function, but by the human experience. Now, instead of thinking only in terms of technical rules, a designer can explore annotations within practical categories like Visual, Interactive, Screen Reader, Cognitive, and Auditory Experience. This shift constantly brings the focus back to the people we are designing for.

From accessibility blueprints to inclusive experiences

Let's examine a concrete example from the Screen Reading Experience category to see how the accessibility annotations make a real-world difference.

Example of first edition Accessibility Design Tools annotations. Two separate purple callouts point to a checked checkbox. The first callout reads, 'Role: checkbox'. The second reads, 'Properties: aria-labelledby: [IDControlLabel], aria-checked: true'.

A checkbox must clearly communicate its purpose and current state for users navigating with a screen reader, ensuring the information is accessible through non-visual channels. To annotate a checkbox, designers previously had to use two separate annotations: one for the element's role ("checkbox") and another for its state ("checked").

Example of new, streamlined Accessibility Design Tools annotations. A single purple callout points to a checked checkbox, combining the role and properties. It reads: 'WAI-ARIA, Widget Role: checkbox. Properties: aria-labelledby: [IDControlLabel], aria-checked: true'.

Because these are almost always used together, we've merged them into a single, streamlined component. For the designer, this brings greater efficiency and consistency, thanks to a curated set of predefined roles that eliminate the need to invent or guess at role names. For the user, it delivers something far more important: a truly inclusive experience they can depend on—just as the designer intended. This is just one of many thoughtful enhancements in the second edition, all designed to help you build inclusive and accessible experiences that users of all abilities can depend on.

If you're already using SAP's Accessibility Design Tools, you'll love the enhancements. If you're new, now is the perfect time to load our library in Figma and make accessibility a core part of your design process.

Get started today:

  • Download the Accessibility Design Tools Handbook - Second Edition
  • Access the Accessibility Design Tools Library in the Figma Community
  • Try out the Accessibility Design Tools - Second Edition, Plugin for Figma
  • Help us improve by sharing your feedback: a11ydesigntools@sap.com

entry.title: 5 Tips for Getting Started with the SAP Fiori for Web UI Kit
entry.content:
The SAP Fiori for Web UI Kit is your go-to resource for creating consistent, efficient, and accessible user interfaces. The kit helps you design faster without starting from scratch.

Here are five helpful tips to get started and design with confidence:


1. Explore the full component library first 

Before jumping into design work, begin with the design foundations separately, such as color, typography, and shadows. Understanding these basics early on will help you make better, more consistent decisions throughout your work. You’ll also find SAP icons and product illustrations integrated directly into the kit. 

Once you're familiar with the foundations, take time to explore the full set of components included in the file. The UI kit provides a wide range of ready-made elements, scalable and fully aligned with SAP’s design principles, all in one place. 


 2. Use variables to switch between themes easily 

In the SAP Fiori for Web UI Kit, variables control core style properties such as colors, typography, and spacing. 

The kit includes support for multiple themes that reflect SAP’s visual language in different environments. The default light theme is called Morning Horizon, and for low-light settings, the Evening Horizon theme provides a dark mode alternative. 



Using variables, you can switch between these themes easily within your Figma file. This lets you preview how your designs will look across different user preferences without rebuilding components from scratch. 


3. Use the Slot for content placement 

Some components, such as Dialogs or Cards, include a Slot - a clearly marked area (highlighted in orange) where you can insert your own content, like text, icons, or buttons, while keeping the original structure and behavior intact. 

To use it, simply select the Slot layer in the component and replace it with your own content using the “Swap instance” option in the right-hand panel. There’s no need to detach the component, your changes will stay consistent and maintain the design integrity. 
 

 
Using the Slot keeps your designs flexible, editable, and easy to maintain. 

 

4. Keep your file organized and use naming conventions 

Maintaining a well-organized file helps you and your team navigate and manage designs efficiently. Use clear naming conventions for frames, components, and layers so it’s easy to find and update elements later. This practice saves time and reduces errors, especially as your designs grow in complexity. 
 



5. Stay in sync with releases 

The SAP Fiori for Web UI Kit is actively maintained and regularly improved with new components, updates, and refinements based on user feedback. To stay up to date, keep an eye on official announcements and communications from the SAP Design team.  You can find the latest releases and enhancements on our SAP Design System Portal “What’s New” page. 

The SAP Fiori for Web UI Kit gives you more than a set of components, it provides a solid foundation for building enterprise-ready designs that scale.

entry.title: Re: How to add in transaction code MCSI after output drill down addition of new radio button field
entry.content:
Hello
My name is Raquel.
I'm from Brazil and I'll try to help you with this question. I hope it's helpful.

Step-by-step (LIS / MCSI with info structure S510)

1) Confirm where the field exists

  • The field must exist in the communication structure of the application (SD/MM/PP etc.) that feeds S510 or as an append/CI in that structure.

  • Common examples (depending on the module):

    • SD: MCVBAK, MCVBAP

    • MM-PUR: MCBPR, MCBPRK

    • MM-IM: MCINV*

If the field was only created directly in table S510, it will not be updated automatically. LIS updates S510 from the communication structures + update rules.

2) Populate the field in the update flow (user exit)

  • Use an enhancement/user exit in LIS to move the value from the application to the communication structure.

  • Create a project in CMOD, attach the enhancement for your application (for example, in SD it’s something like MCS*, in MM it’s MCEK* etc.), and in the EXIT include write something like:
    *" Inside the LIS update EXIT for your application
    IF <conditions>.
    comm_struct-zz_radio_opt = source_struct-zz_radio_opt.
    ENDIF.
    Note: The exact EXIT/enhancement depends on the application of your S510. (Tip: in the LIS update environment, open the generated program RMCS* for your S510 and check the suggested user exit includes; you can also trace via the update group.)

    3) Include the field in info structure S510

    • Transaction MC18 (or via IMG): choose S510 and:

      • Add the new field as a Characteristic (if you want to group/select by it) or as a Key Figure (if it’s quantitative).

      • For a “radio button” type field (mutually exclusive categories), you usually treat it as a Characteristic (domain with fixed values).

    4) Generate and activate update rules

    • MC25/MC26: regenerate the info structure after changes, review/activate the update group.

    • Check which Update group your S510 uses (MC24/MC25) and ensure it’s active.

    5) Initial load / reprocessing

    • Run the initial load for S510 (the relevant OLI* transaction for your module; e.g.:

      • SD → OLI7*

      • MM-PUR → OLI3*

      • MM-IM → OLI1*

    • This will recalculate historical records including your new field.

    6) Appear in MCSI

    • Now open MCSI, select S510:

      • Your field should appear in Characteristics (for selection/layout) and in the catalog of the analysis.

      • Adjust the Layout (rows/columns) and save a variant if needed.

Quick Validation Checklist

  • Field exists in the communication structure (not just in S510).

  • EXIT/Enhancement fills the field (test via debug when creating/updating a document).

  • Field added as Characteristic/Key Figure in MC18.

  • Info structure generated/activated (MC25/MC26).

  • Initial load done (correct OLI* for the module).

  • Field available in MCSI (selection, drill-down, layout).

Tips & Gotchas

  • Radio button field: usually this is a domain with fixed values (e.g., A/B/C). In LIS, treat it as a Characteristic for segmentation.

  • If the field doesn’t show up in MC18 as selectable:

    • Check if the Data Element has a valid domain with fixed values.

    • Check if the communication structure used by S510 sees the field (append activated and transported).

  • After changing structures, always Generate the info structure again before testing MCSI.

  • If S510 is custom (S5xx): keep consistency between Application (SD/MM/PP), Update group, and Base tables used in generation.

    👉If you tell me the module of your S510 (SD, MM-PUR, MM-IM, PP, etc.) and the technical name of the field, I can give you:

    • The exact EXIT to use,

    • A ready ABAP snippet to fill the field,

    • The correct OLI transaction for reloading.

  1. Which SAP module does your info structure S510 belong to?

    • SD (Sales & Distribution)?

    • MM-PUR (Purchasing)?

    • MM-IM (Inventory Management)?

    • PP (Production)?

    • Or a custom application?

  2. The technical name of your new field (e.g., ZZRADIO_OPT).

⚡With these, I can tell you:

  • The exact communication structure where the field must be appended,

  • The user exit / enhancement name where you’ll write the ABAP logic,

  • A ready-to-use ABAP snippet for populating it,

  • The OLI transaction you’ll need to run for reloading historical data.

entry.title: Re: Payment is NOT debatching - Reprocess Bank Statement...
entry.content:
Hi @JENN93 ,

Pl. explore below options.

AreaCitibank (Working)HSBC (Issue)Action / Check
Bank Statement File ContentCAMT.053 / BAI2 file includes line-item details (<NtryDtls> or equivalent) per vendorFile appears to include batch-level only, no vendor-level granularityCompare raw bank statement files side by side
MBC MappingMapped to capture End-to-End ID / vendor referencePossibly mapped only at batch header levelAdjust mapping in MBC Mapping Cockpit
Posting Rules (Manage Posting Rules App)Posting algorithms split entries by reference/vendorPosting algorithm may use only header dataAssign algorithm like 019 (Reference) or 029 (End-to-End ID)
Clearing Rules (Manage Bank Statement Rules App)Rules defined per Payment Reference → results in debatchingMissing or not splitting by vendor referenceDefine rule to split by reference / End-to-End ID
Payment ID UniquenessEach payment has unique End-to-End IDHSBC may not provide unique IDs per vendorRequest HSBC to enrich file with detailed End-to-End IDs
System Result in Reprocess Bank Statement AppVendor-level items visible and cleared separatelyLump-sum batch shown, no vendor splitFix depends on file enrichment + mapping/rules

Summary:-
-Citibank files contain line-item details → debatching works. HSBC files likely only have batch headers → no split in Reprocess Bank Statement tile.
-Fix = check file structure, adjust MBC mapping + posting/clearing rules, or request HSBC to provide enriched ACH statements.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback. Used GenAI
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Document Grounding: A (hidden) gem in SAP Business AI’s portfolio for smaller companies.
entry.content:
Smaller organisations typically want to have a small entry level cost to get started with any new investments.  Document grounding AI feature from SAP has a commercial structure to support this. Together with the free Joule Base I believe document grounding is a great opportunity for SAP's partners to introduce SAP Business AI to ALL their customers (also the small customers), and to ALL the users to quickly get benefit, at an extremely reasonable price.

What is document grounding?

Are you are familiar with the “informational” pattern in Joule?   A user can ask Joule about how something works in their SAP system.  Joule gives answer based on the knowledge on the SAP Help Portal.  This is made possible by the fact that SAP has already  “grounding” Joule with the information on the help portal and then using this information to formulate an answer to queries of users, leveraging LLMs.  Some people describe this as “training Joule”.   Technically this is probably not the correct term, but it gives a good idea of what it is.

What if a company could “train” Joule to answer any questions related to their customer specific situation?  This is possible with “document grounding”.   SAP customers can “upload” their own documents with important information about how they work, and Joule can be “trained” to answer user questions on these informations. 

What are examples on how companies can use document grounding?

  • HR policies: most companies have documents describing their policies regarding vacation, travel, car policy, expense policies etc.  Joule can be grounded on these documents and serve as basis for users to get answer to their queries.
  • Working instructions: most companies have special instructions on how to work in the SAP system.  For example, specific ways to do month end processes, how to book a purchase invoice to split cost over departments, which specific G/L account to use for special bookings, special business rules for specific suppliers etc.  These working instruction documents can be including in document grounding for Joule.
  • Product information: one example I heard about was a company with a huge list of product SKU with interdependencies which they grounded into Joule so that salespeople could use Joule to answer their questions about best product fit for a customer.
  • The opportunities are endless.  If an SAP customer has any written documents their users need to consult now and then, these documents are candidates for document grounding in Joule.   I recommend SAP partners to brainstorm about this with their customers.

Here is an example of a user leveraging Joule to query their company’s specific documents.  The answer is obviously not based on SAP help portal information, but on a specific customer HR policy document:

How much does document grounding cost?

There are two cost elements:  First, the “training” of Joule; uploading, indexing, and storing the indexed information in the right format for Joule to use it.  

Secondly, every time the user query the documents via Joule, Joule leverages LLMs to put together the answer.  The good news: since June this year this is now part of “informational” pattern in Joule Base and thus free for customers running a SAP LOB solution where Joule is support, as I wrote about in another article.

Let’s look at an example for the indexing cost:  A company has 40 documents they want to include in document grounding.  Each document is 50mb large.  This will cost 16.80 euro per year.  You read it correctly: 16.80 euro, less than 17 euro!!  (we are NOT talking about 16.8K).    This cost includes the initial indexing and constant reindexing when the customer makes changes to the documents.

Here are the detailed calculations:  Document grounding is a premium transactional AI feature.  The pricing is 0,005 AI units per record per month (for practical purposes, a record is up to 50Mb of documents).  As the list price of 100 AI units is 700 (thus 7 euro per 1 AI unit), this would be the full calculation:

40 records * 0.005 AI units * 7 euro per AI unit * 12 months = 16.80 Euro

The core pricing  information for this calculation can be found in the SAP AI Features Guide Price List :

How can a customer get going with document grounding?

  • Order Joule base and get it up and running.  Read more
  • Purchase at least 100 AI units.  Even though the example above only needs 2.4 AI units for a whole year, the minimum purchase requirement for SAP AI units is 100 units (with a list price of 700 euro in Europe). 
  • Understand the document ground technical product requirements. Main point here is the requirement of where the customer store and manage their documents in the first place (MS SharePoint or SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition). 

Can partner test and demo document grounding in their TDD systems?

No, not right now.  However, it will become possible at the end of October 2025 when SAP will launch a special AI unit for TDD.

For more information about document grounding, check the AI feature catalog  (tip: toggle to the second image in the image box and play the demo video).   Please also have a look at pages 15-16 the official SAP L3 deck on Joule.

entry.title: Re: The Complete Guide to Calling Actions in UI5 with Custom Code
entry.content:
I was struggling for a while to call a static RAP action behind a v4 service.

RAP does not have unbound actions (because you can declare actions only inside a behaviour so by definition they are always bound). But it does have static actions (so you can call them without passing a single entity as a parameter).

Maybe this can be added to the guide to make it truly complete @Marian_Zeis 

You have to create a context for the entity collection itself and then pass this context to invoke action. Otherwise the framework will not find your static function. For the function name make sure to use the full qualified name (with the service qualifier as a prefix).

const oExtensionAPI = this.base.getExtensionAPI();
const oModel = oExtensionAPI.getModel();
const oContext = oModel.bindContext("/EntityContainerWhereActionIsDefined");
try {
    const oEditFlow = oExtensionAPI.getEditFlow();
    await oEditFlow.invokeAction("com.sap.gateway.srvd.zmy_service.v0001.MyStaticAction", {
        contexts: oContext
    });
} catch (oError) {
    // handle error
}

entry.title: Van stock visibility without using storage locations
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We currently have our service technician vans represented as storage locations on our ERP, but as we have hundreds of service technicians, this causes a big maintenance effort in terms of customizing due to the usual changes happening with the technicians (new hirings, resignations, change of address, etc).

Does anyone has experience with other solutions (in S/4 or even other SAP products) which could be used to represent the service technician vans and still allow us to have the visibility we have today of the stock existing on each van?

 

Thanks,

Nuno

entry.title: Re: Bpay Biller code and CRN capture in SAP for Accounts...
entry.content:
Hi @priyalizthomas @Alister07 ,

Pl. explore below options.

 

StepAreaTransaction / ObjectAction / SettingNotes
1Payment Method SetupFBZP → Payment Method in CountryCreate new payment method “BP” (BPay)Suppress IBAN/Bank Account checks since BPay does not use them
2Payment Method per Company CodeFBZP → Payment Method in Company CodeAssign method “BP” to company codeAllow “Outgoing payments” only
3Vendor Master DataBP / XK02Add fields for Biller Code and CRNOption A: Custom fields (preferred) Option B: Reuse Bank Key = Biller Code & Bank Account Number = CRN
4Invoice ReferenceFB60 / F-43Enter CRN in Reference field (XBLNR)Use if CRN changes per invoice
5Payment Medium FormatDMEE (Payment Medium Workbench)Create / copy format tree for BPayReplace bank details nodes with Biller Code + CRN
6Field Mapping in DMEEDMEE Tree MaintenanceMap fields: – Biller Code → Vendor Master (custom or Bank Key) – CRN → Invoice Reference (XBLNR) or Vendor MasterEnsures correct output to payment file
7House Bank SetupFI12Optional: Define House Bank for BPayOnly if required by bank file structure
8Payment RunF110Run payment program with method “BP”File will generate with Biller Code + CRN instead of bank details
9File TransferBank Connectivity (MBC/BCM)Upload payment file to bankFormat must match BPay standard

Summary:-
-Biller Code = Vendor ID in BPay → usually fixed per vendor.
-CRN = Your reference with vendor → may be fixed or vary per invoice.
-If same vendor uses both EFT & BPay, use custom fields instead of reusing Bank Key/Account.
-DMEE is critical → it decides whether bank details are replaced with BPay fields.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback. Used GenAI
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: List Report V4 - Hide Copy action button
entry.content:
xmlns="sap.m" xmlns:smartTable="sap.ui.comp.smarttable"
<smartTable:SmartTable>
        <smartTable:copyProvider>
            <plugins:CopyProvider  visible="false" enabled="false"/>
        </smartTable:copyProvider>
</smartTable:SmartTable>

 This also hides the copy to clipboard button in the table toolbar when using smart table ( v2 )

entry.title: Re: Impact of a U.S. Federal Government Shutdown on E-Verify
entry.content: @walters-alison88 Both Onboarding 1.0 and Onboarding will indicate that E-Verify is unavailable in red text, the same message that a user would receive in the event the service was temporarily unavaialable.

entry.title: Re: Impact of a U.S. Federal Government Shutdown on E-Verify
entry.content:
The shutdown has indeed occurred, this is no longer an "if" scenario. I will continue to provide updates here as they come in.

From the E-Verify service directly, I've received confirmation that their service is affected:

E-Verify is not available due to a lapse in Department of Homeland Security appropriations and due to a lapse in statutory authority for the E-Verify program. While E-Verify is unavailable, employers cannot access their E-Verify accounts. Customer support services are also unavailable.

Employers must continue to complete and retain Form I-9, Employment Eligibility Verification, within the required time for every person hired to work for pay in the United States.

Employers using an alternative procedure authorized by DHS to perform a remote examination of employees’ Form I-9 documents may continue to do so if they remain enrolled in good standing in E-Verify during the lapse in DHS appropriations.

Employees cannot resolve E-Verify Tentative Nonconfirmations (mismatches) during this time. Employees with a Social Security Administration mismatch must wait until E-Verify resumes operations to visit an SSA office to resolve their mismatch. 

For more information, please visit E-Verify What’s New.

We apologize for any inconvenience and appreciate your patience.

entry.title: AI-assisted scoping and configuration services (CBC AIX) are activated by an AI unit contract
entry.content:
How to know if AI-assisted scoping and configuration services (CBC AIX) can be activated for an SAP S/4Hana Cloud Public Edition system?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: AI-assisted scoping and configuration services (CBC A...
entry.content:
Integration of AI features with SAP Central Business Configuration, AI-assisted scoping and configuration services (CBC AIX) are activated by an AI unit contract. 

SAP AI Unit License allows the customers to use AI features via AI units. So customers with these licenses will have AI features visible in the Business UI tab and they will be provided access to CBC to activate and deactivate the AI features. Please refer note 3632594 - Information about the upcoming integration of AI features with SAP Central Business Configuration (CBC), activated by an AI unit contract. for more details.

If you have any question about AI unit license, please further contact your SAP sales representative to get the AI Unit license tailored to your business needs.

entry.title: Update the status to “Sent to bank” in the Monitor Payments application - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Experts, good afternoon.

We are currently implementing scope item 2YM for the automatic payment process. This API allows integration with CPI so that the file can then be sent to the bank. Likewise, the payment formats used are customized Z formats due to the requirement.

On the other hand, the SAP BCM solution is not being used in its entirety due to cost issues.

API Implemented

My question is as follows:

- How do I update the following statuses: “Sent to Bank,” “Completed” in the following application?

- Is there a BADI, Custom Logic, API, or missing configuration that allows me to update the statuses?

Thank you very much.

I look forward to any support and/or recommendations.

Best regards,

entry.title: Devtoberfest Badge Checker is available for 2025
entry.content:
Just like last year and the year before, I’ve updated my Badge Checker for Devtoberfest 2025.

Features

  • Overview of all badges you can earn

  • Check to see which badges you already have and what’s still missing

  • See your current points and what you need to reach the next level

  • Direct link to your Devtoberfest gameboard

New for 2025

  • Dark mode

  • Shows your username and avatar

  • Remembers your sort and filter settings

  • Displays badge descriptions

Quick bookmark links

You can bookmark your profile using your SAP Community ID or your username, for example for DJ:

  • https://devtoberfest.marianzeis.de/?scnId=53 

  • https://devtoberfest.marianzeis.de/?scnId=qmacro 

 

Of course built with OpenUI5. The source code is available on GitHub.
Thank you @thomas_jung for your help!

entry.title: Re: Why asset doest not have material code in SAP ERP?
entry.content:
Hello @nithin_pranesh 

Thank you for your follow-up

If a purchase requisition (PR) is not subsequently converted into a purchase order (PO), the asset created during the PR phase will not be automatically removed; manual deletion or retirement will be required. In a public cloud environment, it is considered best practice to establish an asset shell at the PR stage and subsequently enrich it during the Goods Receipt (GR) or Capitalisation process.

To minimise duplication, it is also advisable to configure automatic asset creation at the PO or GR stage (scope item J62). This approach ensures that comprehensive asset details are captured only when they become available. Refs: Scope Item J62 – Asset Acquisition

With kind regards

Chuma
